title: 19-year-old Manassas man killed in pickup truck crash
text:
Authorities have charged a Prince George’s County man on suspicion of reckless driving after a deadly pickup truck crash in Fauquier County, Va., left his passenger dead.

Virginia State Police said Brayan E. Moreira-Saravia was driving a Ford F-450 shortly after 1 p.m. Friday when he ran off the roadway, overcorrected and collided with another pickup truck.

His passenger, Brian Reconis, 19, of Manassas, Va., was not wearing a seat belt and was ejected from vehicle, authorities said. Reconis died at the scene, near the intersection of route 612 and 610.

The driver of the other truck was not injured, police said.

Moreira-Saravia, a 19-year-old Brandywine, Md. resident, was charged with reckless driving and failure to maintain proper control.

The crash remains under investigation, authorities said.
description: The driver, who survived with minor injuries, has been charged with reckless driving.
